session.new: tmux new -s <name> - create a new named session
session.attach: tmux attach -t <name> - attach to an existing session
session.detach: prefix + d - detach from current session

window.next/prev: prefix + n / prefix + p - switch windows

pane.switch: prefix + arrow keys - move between panes
pane.resize: prefix + ctrl + arrow keys - resize pane

plugins.ctrl+f: grep all files in sub-directories with preview (fzf+bat), enter will open in new pane with nvim
grep all files in sub-directories with preview (fzf+bat), enter will open in existing vim

general./: search in file (n/N to loop results)

windows_and_buffers.ctrl+w: leader key to enter window mode
windows_and_buffers.T: separeate split buffer into new window/tab

command_line.%!jq '.': filter entire file through jq (system JSON processor), pretty-print JSON

change.c: change operator, used with a motion
change.cw: change from the cursor position to the end of the current word
change.ciw: change the entire word under the cursor
change.ci(: change inside parentheses, brackets, or quotes
change.C: change from cursor to end of line (c$)

navigate.t{char}: move before next occurrence of character
navigate.*: highlight all occurrences of word under cursor
navigate.%: jump to matching bracket, parenthesis, or brace
navigate._: go to first non-blank character in line

select.ctrl+v, k/l, I, esc: Perform an insertion on multipple lines

search_replace_advanced.:%s/foo/bar/g: replace all occurrences of 'foo' with 'bar' in file

registers.%y+: yank entire file to system clipboard
registers.\"_d: delete without affecting clipboard (black hole register)

editing_shortcuts.J: join next line with a space
editing_shortcuts.U: restore entire line to last saved state

basic.jq -c '.': compact output - JSON on one line

filters.jq '.key | length': get length of array or string
filters.jq 'keys': list all keys in an object
filters.jq 'map(.key)': extract key from each object in array

output_control.jq -c '.[]': compact each array element on one line
